body_html:
We are in the process of switching to Bazel as our source of truth. I'd be surprised if anything is broken, but if so it's something we'd want to track down immediately. Can I trouble you for more details?
…
On Sun, Feb 12, 2017, 9:38 AM Liangliang He ***@***.***> wrote: @ctiller <https://github.com/ctiller> Is bazel still supported in gRPC trunk? Looks like there are somethings broken, like unreferenced header, incorrect header path, redefined symbols etc. I'm trying to solve them to make it build with tensorflow. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. We are in the process of switching to Bazel as our source of truth. I'd be
surprised if anything is broken, but if so it's something we'd want to
track down immediately.

Can I trouble you for more details?

body:
We are in the process of switching to Bazel as our source of truth. I'd be
surprised if anything is broken, but if so it's something we'd want to
track down immediately.

Can I trouble you for more details?

On Sun, Feb 12, 2017, 9:38 AM Liangliang He <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @ctiller <https://github.com/ctiller> Is bazel still supported in gRPC
> trunk? Looks like there are somethings broken, like unreferenced header,
> incorrect header path, redefined symbols etc. I'm trying to solve them to
> make it build with tensorflow.
>
> —
